alert.note: Alert for Menifee; Morgan; Rowan (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 27 at 9:14PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Morgan, southeastern Bath, Menifee and southwestern Rowan Counties through 945 PM EDT... At 914 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Crooks to Ratlitt to near Scranton to Yale. Movement was southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Scranton, Ratlitt, Yale, Zilpo, Cogswell and Lick Fork around 920 PM EDT. Bangor around 925 PM EDT. Dan, Big Woods, Mariba and Paragon around 930 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Wellington, Korea, Ebon, Denniston, Leisure, Kellacey, Artville, Zag, Blaze, Frenchburg, Omer, Twentysix, Dehart, Yocum, Tabor, Fagan and Wrigley. THIS INCLUDES Interstate 64 in eastern Kentucky between mile markers 119 and 124. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
